newsitem.title: UK: S&P says SAI resignations won't hurt ops.
newsitem.headline: S&P says SAI resignations won't hurt ops.

text.p: Standard & Poor's said on Tuesday that the resignation of Salvatore Ligresti and Fausto Rapisarda, respectively Chairman and Managing Director at Societa Assicuratrice Industriale (SAI), would have no detrimental effect on operations in the short-term.

"Standard & Poor's believes that operations will not be adversely impacted in the near term as Ligresti and Rapisarda were not involved in the day-to-day operations of the company," S&P said in a statement.
S&P said it would re-evaluate the rating "if these are material positive or negative development".

It said the Isvap, the insurance industry control body, asked Ligresti and Rapisarda to resign after the Supreme Court sentence in a case concerning bribes paid in 1992 by the Ligresti group in order to win an insurance contract from Ente Nazionale Idrocarburi, Italy's state-owned energy company.

"Standard & Poor's understands that the Board of Directors will elect a new Chairman next Monday and will continue to monitor the developments at SAI, especially regarding management and the forthcoming decision concerning Ligresti's 43.8 percent stake in SAI through Premafin," the statement added.
